meanings.definition: To pretend to be someone or something that one is not.
meanings.sent1: She was phoneying as a famous actress at the party.
meanings.sent2: He got caught phoneying his way into the exclusive club.
meanings.sent3: The kids were phoneying being superheroes in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The scam artist was phoneying his identity to steal money.
meanings.sent5: The spy was phoneying his accent to blend in with the locals.

meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone by pretending to be something one is not.
meanings.sent1: The con artist was phoneying his credentials to get the job.
meanings.sent2: She was phoneying her emotions to manipulate him.
meanings.sent3: The magician was phoneying his disappearance act with a trapdoor.
meanings.sent4: The imposter was phoneying his way through the security checkpoint.
meanings.sent5: The student was phoneying his excuse for not doing the homework.
